intro: Cuphea calophylla var. mesostemon, commonly known as the red-veined cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers with contrasting green veins. The plant produces showy inflorescences that are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant color. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. The leaves are ovate and glossy, adding to its aesthetic appeal in both garden and container settings.
